Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

validation.validation: Discard on Exit Validation Error

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Student Course Auto generate Section Numbers

Student_Course_Data.description: Student Course Data Snapshot Data subelement for Student Course Data, on web service.

validation.validation: Exactly one Academic Unit must be designated as the Course Inventory Owner.
The total Default Offering Percent for all Academic Units must equal 100.
Exactly 1 Student Course Component must Control Grading.
The Student Eligibility Rule is not valid for the Course Definition due to its type.
Co-Requisite Courses must be Approved or Approved with Pending Update.
Co-Requisite Courses cannot end before the Effective Date of the Course.
Courses cannot be Co-Requisites of themselves.
The effective date of the Student Course is not valid for the Academic Unit Configuration
The Student Eligibility Rule Name cannot be edited when editing or creating a new course if the Student Eligibility Rule already exists for that course.
The Allowed Locations must be Active and a Campus.

One can only specify Combination Instructional Formats using the Student Course Combination Instructional Format Contact Hours Data element if the Course Component Instructional Format, Combination, has been specified using the Student Course Component Data element.
One cannot select duplicate Combination Instructional Formats.
An invalid Instructional Format has been specified for use as a Combination Instructional Format.
The Co-Requisite Course must have an Effective Date that starts on or before the Effective date of the Course.
The Course Tag's Academic Unit is not in the same Institution as the Academic Unit for the Course Definition.
Total Course Contact Hours must equal the sum of the Course Component Contact Hours.
You must specify at least 1 Other Unit Type and Other Unit Value when you select the Other Unit Values check box.
Auto Generate Course Section Numbers cannot be enabled if Course Sections exist.
Each special topic for a course must have a unique title.
This course cannot be set to repeatable when it belongs to a Course Equivalency Group with a usage of Grade Replacement.
All Academic Units must belong to the same Institutional Academic Unit.
You must select a Unit Type that was configured on the effective Course Unit Type Policy for the owning Academic Unit of this Course.
Course must be Repeatable for Additional Credit in order to Allow Concurrent Enrollment.
Maximum Units cannot be less than Minimum Units
Minimum and Maximum Units need to be divisible by the Partial Unit Increment.
Partial Unit Increment must be 0.50, 0.25 or 0.
Partial Units are enabled when Minimum Units is less than Maximum Units.
Ensure that each Instructional Format is assigned to the course only once.
Specify at least 2 and up to 3 Combination Instructional Formats.
To specify a repeatable course, ensure Repeat Maximum Attempts is greater than or equal to 1.
Ensure Repeat Maximum Units is greater than or equal to the Minimum Units value.
To specify Overridable Course Field Reference, set Section Overrides Allowed to true.
Please only select Course Overridable Fields that can be used with Configurable Overrides.
To submit a course, make sure that the academic unit for Learning Outcomes is the same as the institutional academic unit for the owning academic unit for the course.
The course already has an event in progress. Complete the event before submitting this student course.
